Description: OPEC decides to maintain production target of 30 million barrels/day despite falling prices to compete with US shale
OPEC agrees to cut production by 1.2 million barrels/day - first cut in 8 years
Russia and 10 other non-OPEC countries join production cuts totaling 1.8 million barrels/day

Event_Name: US Withdraws from Iran Nuclear Deal
Description: Trump administration withdraws from JCPOA and imposes sanctions on Iranian oil exports
US grants temporary waivers to 8 countries to continue importing Iranian oil
Drone attacks on Saudi Aramco facilities remove 5.7 million barrels/day of production
Russia refuses to deepen production cuts leading to breakdown of OPEC+ agreement
Saudi Arabia announces production increase and discounts after Russia refuses cuts
OPEC+ agrees to record 9.7 million barrel/day production cut due to COVID-19
WTI May futures contract goes negative (-$37) due to storage constraints and COVID demand collapse
Libyan National Army blockades oil facilities reducing output by over 1 million barrels/day
OPEC+ keeps production cuts in place as demand slowly recovers from COVID
Delta variant surge raises concerns about global demand recovery
US announces coordinated strategic petroleum reserve release with other countries
Russia invades Ukraine triggering fears of major supply disruptions and Western sanctions
IEA announces historic 120 million barrel emergency oil release to calm markets
